value.title: Microsoft Power Apps Tutorial for Beginners -  Build an App in 5 Minutes

In this quick tutorial, you'll be off to the races with Power Apps by building an app from data.  For more Power Apps and Power Platform training, please visit us: https://pragmaticworkstraining.com  - - -

value.title: Microsoft PowerApps for Beginners - Build your first App (Tutorial)
value.excerpt: In this video we show beginners how to create their first Microsoft PowerApp from an Excel spreadsheet in OneDrive  We also show some small tweaks on how to streamline the automatically generated PowerApp. Learn how to: a) Prepare the Excel datasource in OneDrive b) Create the app c) Modify the gallery

value.title: Get started with model-driven apps in Power Apps
value.excerpt: Model-driven app design is an approach that focuses on quickly adding components to your apps. These components include dashboards, forms, views, and charts. With no code, or very little, you can make apps that are simple or very complex. Unlike in canvas app development, where the designer has total control over the app layout, much of the layout in model-driven apps is determined by the components you add. In other words, the emphasis is more on quickly viewing your business data and making decisions than on intricate app design.

value.title: Working with a PowerApps Collection
value.excerpt: In this video, we learn about PowerApps collection. These are a special type of variable that allows you to collect a table worth of information as a variable. You can use it for things like creating a shopping cart.   Functions used:  * Collect * ClearCollect * Patch * Remove * ThisItem * Gallery  Video

value.title: Learn to connect: PowerApps Excel Spreadsheet hosted in OneDrive
value.excerpt: Do you want to learn to use PowerApps Excel Spreadsheets? Then this video is for you. We take an Excel workbook hosted in OneDrive for Business and use it as a data source for PowerApps. This video is the foundation that will let us explore more complicated scenarios in the future. value.title: Learn to use the PowerApps Filter function
value.excerpt: In this show, we explore the PowerApps Filter Function. We discuss the function, how to build a search box, the nuances of the PowerApps Filter SharePoint, and build a custom PowerApps Filter Gallery. Very cool stuff. value.title: Create a model-driven application in Power Apps
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to creating a model-driven app in Power Apps that uses Common Data Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to model-driven apps and Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Do you want to quickly build apps with little to no code? This module will focus on the building blocks of Common Data Service and model-driven apps. These key components will help you build quick business apps in your organization.

topItems.title: Get started with Common Data Service
topItems.excerpt: Common Data Service lets you securely store and manage data that's used by business applications. Standard and custom entities within Common Data Service provide a secure and cloud-based storage option for your data.

topItems.title: Get started with model-driven apps in Power Apps
topItems.excerpt: Model-driven app design is an approach that focuses on quickly adding components to your apps. These components include dashboards, forms, views, and charts. With no code, or very little, you can make apps that are simple or very complex. Unlike in canvas app development, where the designer has total control over the app layout, much of the layout in model-driven apps is determined by the components you add. In other words, the emphasis is more on quickly viewing your business data and making decisions than on intricate app design.
